turn.1: What was the Holywell branch line?
turn.2: Holywell branch line The Holywell branch line was a railway branch line in North Wales that connected Holywell with the nearby main line railway.
turn.3: What was transported on the line?
turn.4: Holywell had plentiful mineral resources, and the branch line was built as a mineral railway.
turn.6: When the local industry declined, the line fell into disuse, but it was reopened as a tourist passenger line in 1912.
turn.8: Road competition made heavy inroads into that business, and the line closed in 1954.
turn.9: Is there anything else interesting about the line?
turn.10: The Chester and Holyhead Railway built a line along the North Wales Coast; the objective was to connect the port of Holyhead with London, by connecting with other railway companies.

turn.12: This would enable the Irish mail, chiefly at the time government dispatches, to be conveyed.
